thread.title_full: Platform to Acquire Chemicals Maker Alent for $2.1 Billion - Bloomberg Business

author: Andrew Marc Noel
title: Platform to Acquire Chemicals Maker Alent for $2.1 Billion
text:
Platform Specialty Products, founded by Nicolas Berggruen and Martin E. Franklin of Jarden Corp. agreed to buy Alent for 1.35 billion pounds ($2.1 billion) to expand the electronics materials part of its chemical portfolio.
Alent investors will receive 503 pence a share under the terms of the offer, Platform said in a statement Monday. The offer is 49 percent higher than Alent’s July 10 closing price. The transaction has the option of a share component, where Alent investors can receive new shares of Platform, up to a 21.9 percent stake.
The purchase is the latest deal in the electronics industry, following on the heels of Merck KGaA’s purchase of AZ Electronic Materials in 2013 for $2.81 billion. Dow Chemical Co. is also a competitor through its Shipley unit that was part of Rohm & Haas. Merck paid 10.7 times earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization.
Cevian Capital agreed to tender its stake. Platform is paying 13.9 times Alent’s Ebitda on an enterprise value basis.
